intro: Teramnus uncinatus subsp. ringoetii, commonly known as the African thornapple, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its spiny stems and showy, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in summer. The plant produces small, berry-like fruits that are edible but often have a bitter taste. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in savanna and woodland habitats. Its botanical features make it an important species for both ecological and horticultural studies.
